授業方法: This class will be offered face-to-face.

第1回: Zero Hour: The End of World War II

Read Iokibe, pp. 1 - 15.
Refer 五百旗頭, pp. 1 - 20.
Read Makoto Iokibe, "American Policy towards Japan's 'Unconditional Surrender."
Refer 五百旗頭 "米国の日本浅慮政策 上巻," 第三章.
第2回:
Read Iokibe, pp. 17 - 46; Richard B. Frank, "MacArthur," Chapter 11.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 21 - 62.
第3回:
Read Richard B. Frank, "MacArthur," Chapter 12.
Refer George F. Kennan, "Memoirs, 1925 - 1950," Chapter 16.
第4回: San Francisco Peace Treaty and the U.S. - Japan Security Alliance

Read Iokibe, pp. 50 - 59; Kenneth B. Pyle, "The Japanese Question," Chapter 3.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 77 - 101; ケネス B. パイル, "日本への疑問," Chapter 3.
第5回: Halting Steps Toward Autonomy: Hatoyama and Kishi

Read Iokibe, pp. 59 - 76.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 77 - 101.
第6回: The Ikeda Doctrine: Establishing the High Growth Consensus

Read Iokibe, pp. 81 - 94
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 103 - 124.
第7回: Dealing with the Legacy of War and Defeat

Read Iokibe, pp. 95 - 105.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 124 - 141.
第9回:
Read Iokibe, pp. 108 - 126.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 144 - 169.
第10回: Japan and the New Cold War

Read Iokibe, pp. 126 - 139.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 169 - 186.
第11回: Japan as Number One: The Phantom Superpower

Read Iokibe, pp. 143 - 170.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 187 - 225.
第12回: Japan Adrift: The End of the Cold War and the Lost Decades

Read Iokibe, pp. 173 - 208.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 227 - 278.
第13回: Finding Relevance in a New World

Read Kenneth B. Pyle, "The Abe Restoration;" Iokibe, pp. 211 - 236.
Refer 五百旗頭 pp. 281 - 316.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
This course will help students to understand and analyze problems in international relations, particularly those that deal with those of people from different regions and cultures. In addition, it will help them to develop their powers of autonomous learning by giving them the skills to identify the sorts of problems that require investigation.

評価.成績評価Grading4:
備考　Note
Students will be expected to participate in class discussions and may be asked to complete small assignments from time to time. These will all factor into the participation grade which is twenty-five percent of the final grade. There were also be two short written assignments which will count as fifteen percent of the grade for each assignment. Finally, there will be two in-class exams, a mid-term worth 20% and a final exam worth 25%.
